text: Saw someone messing up our room.

Defying my parents and staying out all night when I wasn't  
supposed to.

I experienced joy when I got the results - I had made it to the  
second year.

Again, a quarrel had come up in our difficult relationship.  My  
life-partner threw all the books off the shelf.  I am sure that it  
disturbed our neighbours since this happened late in the night.

When thieves broke into our neighbour's house and later we heard 
gunshots.
My inability to assert myself positively in a group.

I felt dusgust with a self-iterested person who ruined the life  
of another by means of utterly unfair methods.

While he was drunk, my life partner tried to hit me.  I felt  
scared and fled to the bathroom.

It was when I discovered that my boyfriend had another girl. I  
discovered it through a letter he wrote to the girl when he was  
away. When I asked him he accepted it.

When my dad gives priority to my kid brother's band and his  
other activities.  We both play in different bands and rehearse  
in my parents garage.
Someone acting stupid in public.

Occured while preparing for a midterm in Social Welfare that I  
thought was going to be very hard and felt unprepared for.

A friend of mine lent me his apartment for holidays and besides  
this he was a fine person. Months later I knew that he died  
tragically in a moto accident. He was very young, and I felt sad  
and couldn't believe it (until today).

I really became sad when mother passed away while I was very  
young.

In primary school I once faltered while answering a question and  
the others started laughing.
Walking on a dark street with noone around.

[ Sometimes I have by accident said to another person something  
in which it is easy to read a negative attitude.]

One day I was angry with my friend who went into my drawer and  
took a piece of paper on which I wanted to write a letter and  
used it for her business without my knowledge.

While taking a short cut through the Vasa park, I was surrounded  
by three people who tried to steal my money.  I was scared and  
was saved only by the appearance of other people.

When I had left my home, my father, under false pretences, got me  
in his car and drove home where we were all alone. He was seethed  
with rage because I withrew from his authority. He hit me, kicked  
me and threatened me.

We had to take our cat to the vet for mercy killing (an  
injection).
When I found out that I can travel with my best friend.

When I received a letter from the university telling me that my  
application had been accepted.

I had a little cat which was very sick. As I liked it very much I  
going to a veterinary with it. He told me how to tend it and it  
really recovered its health. Everybody said that I had saved its  
life.

The time I was threatened with expulsion from secondary school (form  
four).

When a pet died. The pet was the closest friend I had for 15  
years.

My friend replying to my letter and again saying he was attracted  
to me and suggesting we write, talk and get together and see how  
things went and his suggestion that I could ring and doing that it  
was really good - though really insane conversation.
[ I have not felt this emotion yet.]
Being caught in changing the truth (lying).

In order to be admitted to my final examination, I had to pass  
two examinations. As I had not studied very much, I resigned  
myself to be left behind. Nevertheless I succeeded in these  
examinations.

When for the first time I rode on a motorcycle with my brother.   
He was going so fast that I felt that I would fall off without my  
brother realizing it.

In 1972 I failed my Examination because of my own crooky  
behaviour of dodging from Examinations.

When I heard that my Uncle had passed away in a road traffic  
accident.
Failing in an examn because of lazyness.

Nearby the end of the year my wife and I were having a car ride,  
when it appears another vehicle, driven by a drunk driver and  
provokes an accident.

When my sister lost my favourite jumper at a party and failed to  
tell me for several days after it happened.

When my grandfather died, with whom I had a very close  
relationship.

When I found out how the people of Ethiopia were starving and  
their government was spending millions on celebrating being in  
power so many years. Then I saw all these people on TV needing  
food, etc.
When I was insulted by a fellow student.

I felt sad when my first boyfriend and I left each other. It was neither  
his fault nor mine.
I was very sad when I heard that my Auntie had passed away.

In a course I thought that I deserved good marks but I only got  
ordinary marks with no justification as to why I was given these  
marks.

Staying alone in the room after midnight and reading horror  
stories.

When I entered the operation theatre and underwent a difficult  
operation.

I was at home, filling my tax report.  Nobody had time to help  
me.  I would have liked to do it quickly so that I could go and  
meet a friend of mine who had just returned from hospital.  I got  
angry as both my brother and my father refused to give me their calculator  
as I had not asked for it nicely.  I could not leave as I  
had to wait for help and the tax report had to be done.

When I heard what mark I had got at the entrance examination and  
I realized my admittance to the University was almost certain.
Talking to someone I disliked.

My dear hamster (called Hannes) died at the age of 2 and 1/2 years.  
His shape forced me to mercy killing (an injection).

I lived alone in a repulsive area in the city of Rotterdam. I was  
annoyed, heard a lot of Burglary and assaults. Especially in the evening  
and the night I frequently felt anxious.
My first public appearance in front of a rathe big audience.

When we took out an 84 year old woman for the evening and had  
hamburgers. She described the evening out as her happiest night  
out in 20 years.
When I, for the first time, failed a junior exam, i.e form 3.

When I failed a test at my primary school.  I was then in grade 7  
and we were about to take the main exam.

Once I worked as a designer. A fitter was hard hit in a damage  
that occurred at the building site I had designed.

Found money on the road and returned it to the owner through  
police.
Make a mistake, offended my friend.

While cycling in the country a dog started running beside me,  
growling and barking, and trying to bite my foot.

When my grandmother, who has been living with us for 14 years,  
had a stroke and was left paralysed on one side. She has been  
quite close to our family and to see her suffer in this way makes  
me feel really sad.

When I don't say the truth, when I don't do a certain thing
thanks to my laziness.

Being invited out by a person I wished to get closer to. He  
telephoned and invited me to go out with him the next night.

The first time that I saw a surgeon cut off a leg and put it in a  
black rubbish bag.

In 1980 when I was in the 12th standard, we had arranged a small  
picnic in Kandala.  One of my closest friends wrote a small and  
cute poem for me, which expressed the feeling of closeness we had  
for each other.  I was very thrilled and I can still remember it.

When I was young I felt guilty because I thought that I had  
commited a grave sin.

Being driven by friend who suddenly swerved and skidded a little.  
It was night and on a long trip. We ended up on side of road.
Diagnosis that I have a stomache ulcer.

This was when I was being followed home every day from the campus,  
by a stranger.  He would follow me to the campus and then sit  
outside my class.  If I was not there he would ask my friends as  
to where I was.  He was a dark, ominous looking person and I was  
terrified of him as I did not know his intentions.  I reported  
him to the security officer, who turned him over to the police.   
I was even more petrified then.

When I woke up at night to find a fire spreading towards the bed  
-rooms.  I was very frightened as I realized that I faced death.
When I was able to buy my new car, after lots of problems.

First weekend back home after one week at Uni I scolded one of my  
sister's best friends for using our telephone. Very silly, but I  
was annoyed because she was there at a time when I needed to be  
with my family.

In a study group, a person always liked to argue on some  
unimportant, irrelevant and minor points.  He tried to persuade     
others in an unfriendly way.  He was obstinate and would not accept   
other's point of view.
When the person that I was very fond of, returned to me.

I unfairly got a low mark on an exam and I failed to win a grant,  
since then I don't have much confidence in myself at an exam.
A man spat on the wall of a house.

I felt sad when my dear friend was needed from training school  
due to his failure in a number of subjects and simply didn't know  
what he had to do.

When I was fighting with my elder brother I unintentionally hurt    
him in the eye with a wooden bar.  I felt guilty and feared that  
he would be blind, fortunately he recovered after 15 days.

I was really hoping that I would pass the examination, but I  
failed and so I felt very sad.

After a difficult exam. When I had not hoped to take it and had  
got a high mark. When you present someone with something and he  
feels glad.
When, for example, I fail in my undertakings.

When I made love with someone who I didn't really love. Sometimes  
I even considered him unlikable.

At my job, I got disproportionately angry with a child.  My  
reaction was not as it should have been.

During a trivial (friendly) discussion, one of the participants  
made an intervention which made me feel uncomfortable.

Finding out that the class leader can go to your lectures, and  
his English is worse than mine.
When my grandmother died - at her funeral.

I was afraid to walk through the forest one day when I dropped  
off the bus around 6.30 pm.
Being insulted in public.

On May 20th I got a summon to appear in court on May 28th 1985 on  
the subject of impregnanting a school girl. I really feared of  
standing in the court in a few days time after this notice. I was  
also embarassed due to formal approach that was expected of me to  
the Principal.
I saw a dog who was eating excrements.
When I won a trip to Greece in a competition.

I had a girlfriend who lived several kilometers away from my  
home. One day she wrote me that she'd visit me. On her way she  
had a car accident and was badly injured. I was very sorry to see  
her lying in a bed in the hospital.
Being chosen to do your experiment with aphasia.
Being in love for the first time.

When I was about seven or eight I was caught having stolen a  
doll's dress from my next-door neighbour.

I do not have accomodation on the campus so I stay with my  
extended family, one young man used bad words while asking me to  
leave their home.

It was the time I went home for my holidays only to find that my  
sister had passed away.  The news had been hidden from me, so  
that I could take my exams.

While quarreling with my brother I broke the glass door of the  
cupboard and a china doll.  We were scolded by my father for  
breaking the door but we did not tell him about the door.

I feel fear quite often but this feeling was very strong last  
year when my husband was quite unexpectedly sent to the hospital.

My academic result was poor and I had to repeat the second year.   
I felt sad about the coming several years.
I missed the last tram home and had to walk in the pouring rain.

The exam was drawing near and I wanted to prepare for it.  But I  
had a lot of other things to do so I did not have much time to prepare   
for the exams.  Whenever I sat down to study I was scared that I would   
not be able to finish it.

I was said to be responsible for my mother getting ill and  
growing thin. I did not realize that it really was my fault until  
several weeks later.

At the butcher's I saw an animal which had just been slaughtered;  
blood was dripping on the floor.

I thought that I would be scolded for a comment I had made, which  
I should not have made.
I made dinner for some friends and they appreciated it very much.

When my grandfather died I was extremely sad.  However my family  
members did not have any special feelings, they said that he was  
already 80 years old.
A relative not acting on her promise.

I experienced it when I was accepted at the Medical Higher  
Institute.
Failing university entrance examn.

When my boss cut off my vacations saying that in that month it  
wouldn't be possible, and after some time he let another girl  
take vacations that month. The anger was because of the  
resentment. Resulting from our bad relationship.
When I dated my friend's boyfriend after they had broken up.

I was ashamed when my boyfriend went to sit with another girl  
when he invited me to come to watch Drama festival.
Joy at meeting a woman I love very much.
Once I lied to my parents and this made me feel very guilty.

When I state things with great positiveness and try to convince  
others, and it appears that my statement is not right.
Death of my father

When I was watching a movie with many violent episodes.  They  
accurately showed the cutting of corpses, etc...

When I stayed in the house of friends, I washed my face and  
wanted to dry it with a towel. This towel seemed to have been  
used over a long time already. It smelled indefinably awful.

When a friend told me that my education had nothing to do with  
our discussion.  This friend has failed the 7th grade, what made  
me angry was that I had not used my education to argue.
I had an accident with damage to the car body.

When I saw the film "Memorie of Prison" I saw a scene of  
masturbation of a man in the hold of a ship apart form fact that  
the film wasn't pleasant I had a leg of coconut candies in my  
hands.

When I was a child I had a grass-parakeet I liked very much. His  
legs were crippled so that he could not move very fast. Once I  
came into the room, did not notice him and stepped on him. A few  
days later he died.

After attending a song contest proposed by a band called "Chyne"  
we (6 of us) waited for the members of the band to greet us in  
front of the stage.  We went out after a few minutes as it was  
time to close the hall.  We had been waiting at the entrance hall  
for ten minutes when three of the band members came out.  They  
were very excited to see us, one of them was so excited that he  
had tears in his eyes.  We felt very warm and close to each  
other.  They took us back into the hall and we talked freely.  We  
were together for about an hour and during this time we felt  
that they were very sincere.
A striking act of ingratitude at a public vehicle.
When I passed standard 8 exams I jumped, rolled over the ground.

It so happened that while staying at anaunt's place I discovered  
that I was afraid of sleeping in pitch darkness.  The room  
which my sister and I were sharing had no light, and I would  
refuse to sleep without having the light of the adjoining  
bathroom switched on.

Once I had torn a few pages off a library book and I felt ashamed  
at this.
When my aunt died.

When I heard that one of my good friends, when at a party, had  
got herself involved with some very undesirable characters and  
was experimenting with drugs.
My being admitted to UNZA.

I took Pharmacology books from my friend's desk without  
permission and I was found guilty.
Fear of sexual overtures from a close relative in the family.

When I do not put in the needed amount of hours of work or study  
for the day, I feel guilty and try to make up for the lost  
time.

I came across a friend with whom I had lost touch for a long  
time.

Our association had Polish visitors and when they were going back  
by boat I did not go to see them off (I am the chairman of the  
association).
Sending pictures home when I'd put on so much weight.
For instance when a girl is interested in me and likes me.

[ When after a night of sleeping in another's arms, one wakes  
alone and knows that the lonely arms of the night are not the  
same that one meets in the morning.]

It happened in a tram: some older people started to grumble about  
the young people just because I had not immediately left my seat  
to them.
Caught lying to my father about a speeding ticket I had received.

I had an accident in which I hurt my eye.  I was afraid of having  
injured it badly.

Saw my class leader acting like a God when he chose people to go 
to your English lectures.

I was very ashamed when I was neglected by a certain friend whom  
I was thinking loved me very much.

At work when I did not get the full co-operation of my colleagues  
to complete an assignment.
I prayed unfaithfully.
Before the examn.
When I learned that two of my friends had had a serious car accident.

When I am in an environment or with a person much worse off than  
me, I realize how privileged I am.

We hitch hiked our way back from a town rather drunk.  We were  
dropped in another town which was unknown to us.  I needed to  
urinate, so I did it on a wall which turned out to belong to the  
military headquarters.  They arrested me and made me pay a fine  
of 500 pts.  We had to go home on foot (6 km) since it was too  
late for anyone to give us a lift.

It was August 30th when I heard on the radio that I passed my  
M.C.E. exams and I was really happy and joyous because of the  
event.
Often I forget to give my immediate family birthday presents.

A good friend of mine died. During the funeral I felt an intense  
feeling of sadness.

At the airport, eighty beer cans that I was carrying in a  
bag spread all around while I was going through the metal  
detector.

When I passed the driving test three weeks ago and got my  
licence.
When my boyfriend went away for a month long holiday without me.
Being insulted by my roommate.

My brother in law was dying of cancer. To see him wasting away  
was very sad.

When walking along the beach with my boyfriend, we saw 2 people  
having sex on the sand dunes in full view of everyone. It was the  
fact that they chose that area in which to have sex, that  
disgusted me.

I was driving near my girlfriend's house and I decided to keep  
going because it was late and I would be back in the next few  
days anyway. The next day she was killed in a road accident.

Finding myself alone in a public toilet block with a man known to  
  have had great psychological disturbances.

I recently became sexually involved with my sister's lover. I  
care for him very much, but I am ashamed of the hurt I may cause  
her.

When two hyenas made crying noise on the window of my bedroom at  
home when I was preparing for my MCE examination during the  
night.

I experienced this when one of my friends reported to the  
Headmaster that I had gone out for beer, whilst the information  
was not true at all. So I had to fight the friend before the  
Headmaster.

There were old people in a crowded bus and I did not have the 
courage to give them my seat.  I closed my eyes to sleep and then 
opened my book to read.  In my heart I wanted to give them the 
seat.

I arrived in Vienna in the middle of the night. I asked for some  
silly information - as I realized myself afterwards - and the inquiry   
clerk reacted in a very arrogant manner.

When I complained to my mother about how untidy the kitchen  
loooked, she boxed my ears ( this had never happened before).

For the girl who halped me go on living and made me happy - when  
I don't see her even for two or three days.

Immediately after the New Year holidays I happened to visit a  
party where there was a lot of alcohol and I became drunk. On the  
next day I felt sort of ashamed when I remembered what I had said  
and done on the night before.

I had been together with my boy-friend for two and a half years,  
when he got to know another girl and not even tried to conceal  
that from me. I drew my conclusions and left him - I also felt a  
bit guilty for what had happened.
When I was left by the person I loved without any reason.

A meeting with the family and the friends I felt dear and loved,  
sharing the gladness of being together at a birthday.

I was doing an experiment and was not getting the appropriate  
result despite the fact that I had repeated the procedure 4-5  
times.  Then finally I got it right by a stroke of luck.

I added a little   ?   to a yield in an experiment to get more of  
a yield.
Selling the appartment after my divorce.
At the seaside, when a wave suddenly came and took off my bikini.
When I finished the work that I had planned to do - my homework.

When I got home from my job, I found a letter from the university  
telling me that I had been admitted to begin my studies.
After a long time I saw my boy-friend again.
People who discriminate other people disgust me.

The day before the university results came out I was both excited  
and scared.  If I failed I did not know what I would do as I did  
not want to work, my family was ambivalent.

In a situation whereby a friend's actions were deliberately  
against my wishes and (with) no regard to my feelings.

When I overslept for the second time on the day I had an  
examination.

For a medical check-up, we - boys and girls - had to take off our  
clothes with the exception of our underwear. Then we had to go  
into another classroom where older pupils were sitting and  
staring at us.

The 2nd time someone I had met cared for came over to my house I  
was absolutely inebriated and was sick into a bucket.
When I was made to feel responsible for the emotional state a friend of  mine was in.

I answered a certain question from Dr. Maqgda wrongly. She asked  
something about Femur and my answer was saying something  
concerning the brain. So I was very ashamed amongst my friends.

When my room-mate made a mess of the room after having drunk the  
whole night at a graduation party ceremony.
Going to see a good film with my best friend.

I met a friend in a discotheque. he was with a girl and he told  
me that she was not his girlfriend.  I, to say something,  
commented that she must be a viscious woman.  He then told me  
that she was his girl.
My grandfather died thirteen years ago.

When my daughter had problems with her friends and I could see  
her predicament from the window.  She was given a the cold  
shoulder.
Can't remember that feeling.

When, after having cleaned up the kitchen, two hours later I saw  
that there was a big mess. It irritated me very much.
Finding out that the girl I like does not like me.
When a girl that I liked didn't accept my curting.

I went to the school library and asked for a book, but the  
librarian told me that there wasn't such. However when an other  
colleague asked for it she gave it to him.

When my friend who was drunk insulted me in public for no reason at  
all.
My father gave money to my brother but not to me.

On our way to France, my girlfriend and I went to Verona. By  
chance we met an Italian couple - they gave us two tickets for  
the dress-rehearsal of "Aida". It was a different world for us  
full of fascination. After the representation we ate a phantastic  
pizza in a restaurant near the "Arena".

I was present when they found a shop-keeper dead in his shop.   
He had been shot with a shotgun at close range.

I thought that I had failed an examination, but when I was  
informed about the mark, I saw that I had passed it.
When I had my first sexual relation and it didn't work.
Over an argument.

I spent all weekend with a friend instead of studying for my  
exams.

When I was in F4 I played a basket-ball match against another  
school's team.  One of their team members kicked a team-mate of  
mine so I kicked him back and we had a fight with each other.
When I had to dissect a live mouse at school.
After an event in which I felt that I had acted unfairly.
At the dentist's, waiting for my turn to come.

During the Christmas holdidays I wanted to invite my brother, his  
girlfriend and their child for dinner. When I said to my  
brother's girlfriend that I would like them to come at my place  
for dinner, she refused and never mentioned it again as if I  
had never asked her.

This happened a year when I was having a hard time, I got  
admission to do research despite obstacles in the procedure of admission.

Having been unjustly punished, I feel disgust towards the person  
responsible.

Not helping parents enough at home and at the farm - this has  
happened many times.

When males in my family try to assign house duties exclusively  
with referance to sex.

I had thrown with the ashtray a still lighted cigarette in the  
plastic wastepaper basket. It had burnt out and my landlords made  
me a row that I might had set their flat on fire.
Someone talking about me at my back.
When I feigned sick leave from work.
When my mother's new husband treated her and my brothers and sisters badly.
Saw a classmate knocked down by a motorcycle.
Not doing well in an examn.

China can not even give you good sound systems for an open  
lecture.

The mother of a person with whom we had been sharing a housing  
accused me of trying to rip her off over payment of bills in the  
house.

When I was accused of having refused to do some hostel work while  
I was at school.  Actually I had not been allocated any work.

When I was ten I got shut in the school with a friend.  I had to  
jump out of a window and cross a beam 10 metres high.

I and my friends got acquainted with a guy from Sofia who turned 
out to be gay, but we found that out only after 2 or 3 days.

In the University we were convoked to a stroll like a freshman I  
was still innocent about the manipulation. On seeing the goal of  
the exaltation to poor character people, I felt anger on feeling  
myself mass of maneuver.

Remembering (at the time I did not feel guilt) in recent yrs. how  
angry I would get when I was babysitting my new brother and he  
would not stop crying. I did not do anything harmful or shocking.  
But I feel guilty for treating him the way I did especially  
since I adore him now. That's why I spoil him now.

When I flew out to my mother and made rude remarks because I felt  
so tense (studied too hard for an examination).
My girlfriend gave me the mitten (left me).

When I heard that a good friend, who had been abroad for a long  
time, would come and see me.

I was then in the 10th standard and was going to my native place.  
The last bus had already left and so I started walking, it soon  
became quite dark.  The road was a village road and was deserted,  
I was not even sure if that was the right way.  I finally reached  
home at 10 P.M.
I felt very happy when I won the football pools.

When the relationship with my first girlfriend broke up and I  
realized it too late.

Accidentally dropped a friends camera flash, so that it was  
broken.

In a warm bus full of people, someone vomited and the whole bus  
stank.

When my sister lost her only son, who was sixteen years old.  I  
felt very bad about it as this was the first death in my family  
and then I learned slowly to understand to life.

Watching an old lady running up the street to catch her bus and  
miss it, it reminded me of my own mother and how dreadful it  
would be to be her in the same situation.
Saw someone who picked up a cigarette from the floor and smoked  it.
When I go out alone at night.

When I took my entrance exams successfully and also when I got my  
school leaving certificate because the delivering ceremony was  
extremely official.

During an argument with my brother, I behaved rather  
intransigently, even cruelly, wishing to morally hurt the "person"  
opposed to me.
I do not study enough as I do not understand it properly.

In an exam when I answered the questions with very little  
assurance due to insufficiet preparation.

While watching a movie, someone who was drunk started vomiting  
helplessly.

My son lives in the country. I feel sadness when I see mothers  
having walks with their children.
When I see dead dogs on the road.
I promised a friend that I would return a book to it's owner for  him , but I forgot to do it.
I feel disgusted with toadies, hypocrites, chameleons.

My sister came back home and reproached me for not having tidied  
up the house, although I had been working all morning and she had  
done nothing.

After being told that an ex-boyfriend had been hurt by my wearing  
something he had given me when I was with another guy. I was  
unaware of my actions really, as I had not considered the fact  
that he had given it to me, and might see me. I still respected  
his opinions of me.

Last night I did not do very well in one of the subjects.  Before  
the result was announced I feared that I would fail.  Finally I  
got a D and as the results of the other subjects were not all       
good I felt a little sad.

Our teacher had invited us to lunch and once at the canteen we  
started introducing ourselves.  Two of the boys showed a lot of  
interest in knowing personal details and then they started  
talking about some activities held in the college.  I had little  
interest in those activities so I talked to another student  
sitting next to me as I was afraid that they would ask me  
questions on those activities.

I wanted to finish a relationship after 3 months. Unfortunately  
my friend had a different opinion. I could not answer his  
feelings this made him unhappy, and me feel guilty.

I was drawn up a statement for an infringement of the traffic  
ordinance. In fact I was innocent.

When I realized that I did not have the basic things needed by a  
student like me.

Did well in an examn just before my father's birthday: the best  
present I can give to my father.
Once I saw some children hunting a cat to death.

When a man rang the doorbell and wanted to enter the house with  
violence. I was alone at home that moment.
Always, and this happens often when I do not keep my word.
I was alone at home on New Year's Eve.

The first time I went away with my boyfriend and lied about where  
we were staying.

When I found a letter addressed "To Mum" by my son, 6 months  
later, he begged me not to sell his new shoes which he messed up  
after wearing them for the first time.

During an argument an acquaintance accused me of having insulted  
her parents by having had sex in their house which they  
overheard.

During a demonstration I climbed up the closed central door of a  
bus.  When the bus stopped I had to go back to the same place,  
afraid that the police would see me.
Hearing a strange noise in the biology building.

In Biarritz (the South of France) I met some English students  
who, especially for me, went to Paris and gave me food, while I  
didn't have any more money.

Last night I had a chat with a fellow student.  I had known her  
for about half a year, and for the first time we were speaking  
"the same language"- meaning an inspiring discussion and  
encounter.

Joy of giving birth, and of sharing that joy with my husband.  
Moments of complete happiness and feelings of so much love.
When I was accepted to study at this school I was very happy.

When I was in a bus on my way to the examination centre, a man     
sitting opposite me kept looking at me continously.  I did not know   
what was wrong.  When I reached the  centre I started strolling around   
as I still had a little time.  Suddenly a man came and whispered "You   
have forgotten to zip up your trousers."  I was at a loss to say anything   
and I felt very embarrassed.  When I thought of the bus incident I felt   
even more ashamed.
When the morning newspaper has not arrived.

I met again a very good friend whom I had not seen for a long  
time.

When I watched TV and saw a performance of "Prince" (a popidol).  
Disgusting he'd better be a stallion.

I was watching TV with a friend. After the first film I wanted to  
watch another film on the same channel. My friend switched over  
to the other cannel without asking me what I wanted.

I was sitting for an exam in biochemistry, I was very excited  
because it was a supplementary examination. I passed the exam  
very well and was glad because I recovered my selfconfidence.
Lecturers being unfair to me in reports.

When diving deep into the sea to reach the floor I felt  
breathless. I was cautious but I doubted I should be able to come  
to the surface and inhale.

In September 1984, I was forced to live with someone I did not  
like.  The first week we were at loggerheads and our conversation  
was like a debate.  The atmosphere was very bad.  When he learnt  
that I had got 95 marks in a test he told me " A failure, You lost  
5 marks."   I was very angry, not because my marks were lower  
than his, but because I could not tolerate his pride.  I did not  
show my discontentment and carried on doing my work.

I was so sad when I heard that my Uncle had passed away. He was 
the only man who was supporting my parents as well as myself.

Finding out that old and useless practitioners of retirement age  
will go to your English lectures and they do not understand  
English.

I thought that I could have avoided the above situation (the one  
in fear) if I had concentrated more on my work, which I hate.

When my mother was seriously ill and had to be admitted to the  
hospital.

I experienced fear when I was not prepared for the final year  
degree exams.

It happened that my brother promised to give me money for school  
and then he told me that he had failed to fulfil his promise a  
day before school started. I became so angry for I thought my  
future would be ruined.

When I saw a wino by some cans with Food Stamps and use the  
change to buy wine.

I overturned in a canoe a few years back and I didn't know how to  
swim. Although I had a life-jacket on I still panicked.

I hate the behaviour of my so called friends, they use bad  
language, spit, boast and treat the youngsters badly.

I wasn't able to see my girlfriend on her birthday and because I  
was late arriving home from uni, I didn't phone her as arranged  
at a certain time (she rang in the meantime).
A mother who shouts at her child for nothing.
Seeing a film in which there were several bloody crimes.
When someone in my family died.

I saw the gare of a prison.  This gare and the building were in  
deplorable condition and were full of rubbish.
Pictures of Nazi extermination camps on a T.V program.

When I was accepted into the medical school.  Medicine is a  
profession that I have desired ever since my childhood.

Six months ago when I got acquaintanced with a person whom I  
trusted infinitely and from whom I expected help and friendly  
feelings. With him I found much in common - in our views and in  
our fate.
My roommate being unconsiderate.

Felt joy a few years ago when I was away on holiday. And sat very  
close to my best friend looking straight into the eyes.

When I was in the army, a room mate of mine came back from  
furlough and threatened another fellow with a knife.

While quarelling with a fellow worker of mine, I was vehement and  
irritated and I told him what I thought of him in plain language.   
I was ashamed of myself when I met him the next day.

A person ignored my advice, did not pay any attention to what was  
saying. She acted as though I wasn't even there. We were doing  
group work so everybody had the right to speak yet she just  
ignored me. She made me feel insignificant.

I felt it when I saw our headmaster blushed ingratiating himself  
with high ranking officials.

One night I was called and told that the father of a close friend  
died. When I visited my friend at home and when attending the  
funeral I felt very sad.
A shop in Downtown wouldn't accept my Visa Card - before December  last year.
Falling over.
I refused to lend my homework to a friend.

I was examined by a teacher I greatly respected. I was well  
prepared on the subjects but he put some side-issues to me and I  
couldn't answer.

After going through a glass door, I sustained a number of serious  
cuts which were gaping open.

A friend came for dinner with me at home. His parents are  
ordinary people. My mother, however, used the very expensive  
porcelain dinner-service and the silver cutlery. I felt very  
ashamed.

When I feel lonely, perhaps because I have to study a lot and I  
is shut up in my appartment.  Nothing happens in particular  
because there is no time for anything else.

The thought that I'll never sit at the school desk again, caused  
a deep grief at the end of my eleventh form.

I was angry about several drivers who showed an aggressive and  
dangerous driving habit.

When the class leader read out the names of those chosen for the  
English lecture and I was not on the list.
The day I learnt that I had been admitted to the university.
Insulted by disgusting people.
I saw a report on T.V news on apartheid in South Africa.

Two boys whom I know were telling me, in an indecent manner, how  
they had teased a young and shy girl I know.  They had despised  
her conviction, scorned and touched her.  I got very angry and  
did not try to conceal it and gave it back to them.

On my birthday a friend came to see me unexpectedly and brought  
me flowers. I usually do not see her very often.

When I realized that I could not communicate properly with my  
closest friend.

Going to Cowell Hospital and finding out tediously that I had a  
stress fracture. The anger came when the senile doctors found out  
4 weeks later that I had 2 stress fractures in one foot and  
should have had crutches. I was in distinct pain and barely could  
walk to classes. They said it would be better in 2 weeks.

When I have suffered a terrible fit of eating, that frequently  
occurs. Then I eat everything, I act like a glutton I eat big  
amounts of food, sometimes even half a loaf.

When my father passed away in 1978.  I was left alone with my  
mother who was very sick so I had to go and live with my aunt, who  
is very short tempered, till my mother was discharged from the  
hospital.

A friend who was 22 years old, died of leukemia; I had not known  
that he was so ill and therefore had not cared.
When I first sat for an entrance examination.

A friend of mine told other people that I was a slattern (because  
of an occurence that had happened some time ago). When I heard  
about that I was very angry.
Before my final examination.

When a friend from whom I preferred to hide my private life  
discovered that I had relations with a man.

I felt it on the same occasion when I felt sadness which finally  
grew into anger.

When I am made to do things in which I see no sense and I waste  
my time. Some time ago I had to participate in a sociological  
investigation and then I got really angry.

A friend of mine was hospitalized after having been diagnosed as  
having typhoid, he had to forgo his exams and also his ambition  
of doing a dissertation at the M.A level.  It was a very sad  
event for me and I felt very sorry for him so I volunteered to  
stay with him in the hospital.

When I dreamt that my family was in trouble and was facing many  
difficulties.

This person I know lied about how much income his parents made  
and received money through grants which he did not need. Another  
person is barely making it, did not lie, and did not receive  
enough money.

I sensed this feeling when I passed successfully the second tour  
of a competition.

I felt guilty because of the pain I caused to a very close  
friend. But over the feeling of guilt, my conviction of being  
right dominated.

The final marks were to be given in the morning.  I wanted to get  
there late because I was very afraid.  When I arrived there,  
everybody was very happy and I had also passed.  We had a  
wonderful time all day long.
My boyfriend returned after a long absence.

When I knew that they would not give me a transfer from one  
university to another.  I began to insult the educatioon  
authorities and the government, I ended up at the door.

After several days delay in my girlfriend's menstration I was  
very glad to see that the pregnancy test was negative.
Forgetting a close friend's birthday.

I wore a dirty dress a certain day I was going to town I met an  
old friend who made a comment about my dress so I felt ashamed.

There was a family fight in my house some time back.  My uncle  
had given me a watch as a present and I lost it.  During the  
fight he accused me of having sold the watch.  I was disgusted at  
his false accusations.
My bed sheet (present of my parents) damaged by roommate.
I forgot to lock the outside door at my Land Lady's place.
A very drunk person.
When a skunk invaded camp.

When I went to see the dead body of my uncle.  This was a very  
dramatic expreience as it was the first time that I entered a  
mortuary.

When I am accused of something I have not done, I get unbelievably  
angry.

I went to see the entrance examination results at university.  I  
rejoyced at my success.
When my grandmother died. I had lived with her for ten years.

We got news that my (almost) 21 years old brother died while  
visiting Europe of a cerebral hemorhage. It finally hit me an  
hour after we saw his corpse in the coffin. It felt like a door  
between himself and everything had closed and locked forever.

When I left after the examination to enter the University, and  
even though I had studied the whole year I made a bad exam.
Being misunderstood by friends.
My sister was afraid of her husband.

While preparing my master's thesis, I was scared that I would not  
accomplish anything as the subject was rather difficult.
Found my name on the list of attending the English lectures.
I did badly in the mid term examination.

During a dance someone slashed my tires and dumped paint on my  
car. I had four other friends with me that I drove and  
furthermore it was raining.
Once I answered my father rudely.

Finding out about the university does not have enough foreign  
currency to buy the yournals in your reference list.

A girlfriend of mine behaves in a very childish way - she does 
not like my going to see a friend who has been introduced to me 
by this same friend of mine.  I would like to be friends with 
both of them, but she does not like this as she is possessive and 
would like me to be close only to her.

I felt glad to live again when I went to a meeting about the  
"Knowledge". There are 4 techniques of meditation that connect  
you with the essence of the human being.
When I see rotten meat.

When I heard that I had got the best result in school and would  
be definately selected to the university of Zambia.
When an alcoholic stood dribbling over a food counter.

I have been afraid several times. What marked me was that I  
almost didn't enter University.

I borrowed a friend's books and forgot I had them, she asked for  
them back and I told her I didn't have them. I duly found and  
returned them.

I felt anger of a friend when she met "a date" and become nervous  
and pest as she always gets when she meets him.

I saw someone that I thought I knew repeatedly drunk. I do not 
like to be around alcoholics.

When I got my results - I had passed the form III exams.  I had 
not expected to do so well.

I was angry at the Cafeteria when the cook scolded and said many  
bad things about me without reason. He thought I was among the  
girls who did him wrong.

I was in my room, I just heard that my Uncle had been caught in  
somebody's house with somebody's wife. He had to appear in court.  
I went to see what would happen to him.
Getting the top price in the football pools.

The day I was told that I had passed my Malawi School leaving  
Exams and I was selected to go to college.

Was picking up my father from work and on passing through the  
Valley watched three prostitutes walk up and down waiting for  
someone to pick them up. Clothing was disgusting.

At the age of 12 (or so) I stole from a Ranger's fruit tree an  
apple. (And eventually was compelled to confess - Dostoersky  
would like this).

Disgust is a feeling that I have never experienced with peoplie  
but , on the other hand, it has been with repulsive animals, i;e  
snakes on T.V.

A good friend deceived me. Because of that little quarrel our  
relationship finished, mainly because she was not honest. I was  
very angry about that.

When I received the acceptance letter from UNZA.  I had just  
come home from work when my kind sister handed me an enveloppe  
which I opened and was overcome with joy.

When reading a newspaper story of a man who had committed  
incestuous acts on his two-year old child - the thought that  
anyone could do such a thing is abhorrent to me.

A similar feeling I felt quite recently while travelling in a  
taxi. The driver treated me roughly and dishonestly - he chose  
the longest route, he overdrawed almost one lev more and he tried  
to be intimate with me.

When I learned that several people had died in the street due to   
the cold weather.

My parents were having a typical family argument.  I came in and  
saw the scene and became angry.

Waking up from a bad dream in a dark night with noone else  
around.

When I passed the whole weekend with my boyfriend, coming back  
home on Sunday afternoon he met my parents for the first time.
In the dark an unreal figure formed by a shadow.
When one has been unjust, stupid towards someone else.

When I won a position on the track-team for the trans-tasman  
games when I was eleven.
The same event described under "shame".
Lying to my grandparents about visiting my boyfriend in Chico.
When I knew the feelings of a beloved person.

I was on a visit to friends who have a baby. The baby was crying  
in another room, but soon it became quieter and it seemed that it  
would fall asleep. I went into the room where the baby was lying  
- and it started crying again.

I was the compere at a party and all my efforts to get the show  
rolling were thwarted by the immobile, non co-operative guests.   
I felt frustation - bordering on anger.
Someone attacked me with a knife.

When my daughter began staying away from classes - at the age of  
nine only.

Carried out a vandalistic act on some windows at an old army  
location.

After a jogging session I had severe abdominal cramps and this  
lead to my wanting to empty my bladder.  My friends gathered  
around me and two of them had to help me to the toilet.  I was  
ashamed at having to go to the toilet in the presence of my  
friends.

It happens sometimes in connection with certain persons with whom  
I have frequent relationships but nothing special.
After the fact that made me ashamed I felt sadness.
Once I did not have enough money to pay for a coffee.
When an event took place in another's life and which I thought I could have avoided.

While watching the movie called "Deer hunter" on TV, when it  
showed how prisoners were treated.
Getting back my Psych 140 midterm.

When I was reprimanded by the manager of the hotel where I  
worked during Autumn 1984.

I wrote an assignment and was given less marks than a friend with  
whom I had previously discussed the assignment.
Bought something bad from the shop and they refused to change it.

In a school parting we agreed to go to a restaurant.  
We met at school and we separated us in several cars. My car  
broke and we arrived late. All those who already had arrived  
stand up and applauded us when we entered two hours late.  
All the restaurant attention was turned on us.

Some boys told me your nickname is "Little Girl Doctor", I did 
not tell them off and laughed with them.
I didn't offer my seat to a pregnant woman in the bus.

Once a week I work as a volunteer in a biologic garden. this work  
in the garden and the contact with other volunteers filled me  
with joy. They also gave me support after I failed passing my  
driver's test.

I had promised to do a task for someone that was close to me, and  
from the outset I knew it was important that I do it, but when it  
came to it, I let them down.

Receiving notification that I had made a successful application  
to the Speech Therapy course at Uni, gave me a very good feelig  
of achievment and joy.

I told a lie about someone to someone else and they found out    
and questioned me about it.
I was angry when somebody stole my half petticoat.
I lost my self-control and raised my voice at a child.

When biking and I felt very bad (problems with heart and  
respiration).

Some time ago a girl tried to make me up without any action of my  
part. She used all possible means. Although I behaved refusingly  
she did not give up for a longer time.

I was all of the sudden sad when I heard that my cousin who  
usually paid school fees had passed away after a very short  
illness.

When I gave water to the plants of a friend. Then one plant fell  
over, and a little statue broke. I, of course, had to tell him  
everything.

I was once chatting with friends. Then some boys came and joined  
us. These boys took all my 3 friends away and I was left alone in  
shame without knowing where to go from there.

My sister was impolite to my father when the family was having  
lunch together at a restaurant.  She thought that our parents had  
been prejudiced against her, this was an extreme thought.

I felt guilty because I had not accomplished a thing as well as I  
had wanted to.

Someone asked me to do something and I made up an excuse and said  
no. I then went and didn't the same thing with someone else and  
hoped the first person never found out.

[ If one has planned to do something "important" and then, for  
some reason, fails to do it.]
Quarreling with classmates.

I was working in a classmate's house with a group. A girl began  
to graze her foot against mine under the table.

When I realised that I was forgiven by the God who is there, when  
I realised how much God loves me and that my acceptance with him  
is not based on my performance - that he loves me unconditionally  
and showed that love in Christ who died because I do need  
forgiveness.

I felt guilty when I spent a night at my boyfriend's place,  
particularly because I had been harsh and spiteful when I had  
left home.  The reason was that I feared a possible discussion on  
the subject and I wanted to leave defiantly.
I felt guilty when I couldn't help a person.

We had to move to a very different city because the company where  
my father worked also moved to that place. It was very difficult  
for me to make new friends than.
When I went to a disco with a friend I started behaving badly  embarrassing him without reason.

It made me very sad to hear that some construction company was  
going to build houses on the beautiful hills by my house.
Good dinner on the National Day.

I was in my village when a bull jumped over a fence and started  
chasing my friends and me.  We were very frightened till we  
climbed up a tree.
Being sexually assulted on a bus.
First time going out with a boy and other people laughed at us.
I saw a lot of starving people in a T.V news report.
The time that I had to put my dog to sleep.

In a fight with my girlfriend in a luncheonette where everybody  
stared at me in such a way that I had to leave it.

When I see people with burns I feel sad, actually I can not even  
express my feelings as I think that they must suffer a lot.
My sister bkoke her leg.

I had made an appointment with a girl to go to the movies, but  
actually I had no mind when we arrived at the cinema, it was a  
full house. I then went back and she went to the movie alone.
I overreacted towards my mother and felt ashamed afterwards.

When a person whom I loved and admired a lot died.  I felt empty,  
lonely, helpless, without support, not knowing what to do.

I was a prefect at secondary school.  On the sports day I told  
others that I would take down the names of the people who  
misbehaved and after some time I sat down for a brief rest.   
Suddenly the head prefect came and scolded me in front of others.  
 I was very angry as there were other prefects sitting and he  
picked on me.  I thought that a brief rest was not  serious  
enough to be blamed.

I ran over my dog with a bicycle when I was carrying him tied to  
the handle bar.

I was very startled when, at night at 2.00 am, a boy approached  
me and yelled "I fuck you", then however he stopped and laughed at  
me.

The negative feelings towards me displayed by my  
"parents-in-law".

A friend was unpunctual, we wanted to prepare ourselves for an  
examination.

Too many people in TV room, I was not able to get a seat to watch  
TV.
Talking to a close friend.
When my grandmother died - having to see my mother weep.

When I heard that there is teasing and bulling at Secondary  
School.
When I was presumed to have stolen maize from the school garden.
I said something especially stupid which I did not mean at all.

When I discovered that the house we had hired in Tonga was full
of cockroaches.

When I was concentrating on my work, my friend disturbed me  
continously.  I asked him to stop but in vain.

I worked together with another student on a computer-assignment.  
She didn't do her best and didn't prepare herself for it. She  
expected me to explain it to her.

After a short stay in Marocco we missed the ferry-boat back to  
Spain and we had to look for an accomodation. By chance we met a  
man who offered to take us to a camping site. While I was sitting in his  
car I was terribly afraid because I had heard of people being  
robbed in Marocco.

When in the end of a semester I got the approval in a matter that 
I judged very difficult.

Eating too much I felt guilty afterwards because I knew I  
shouldn't have overeaten as I'm putting on too much weight.

I got angry with a stranger in a train who behaved impertinently
and immorally
When I fell in love.

I thought of myself as being clumsy when I made love for the  
first time with a girl.

This was when I saw, for the first time, a naked woman  
(prostitute) run away from a house after having been discovered  
by the guardian.
After having failed my driving test.

When I saw my younger sister being bothered by a boy she did not  
know.

When, for example, I was in my eleventh school year and I learned 
I had been classed for the Bulgarian Language and Literature  
National Olympiad.

I wanted to go to a friend of mine who had a party; at the moment  
I wanted to leave, my father said I couldn't go because he needed  
me for some work in the afternoon.

My got my mathematics test's marks and could not believe that it  
was true.  In the past I would have at least 80% marks.  Was I  
getting weaker at studies ?  This made me feel that I should not  
expect too much from going to the university.

We were at school, in the room for audiovisual classes.  We were  
watching a film, and just behind me two classmates were bothering  
me with their mocking and shoves.  I reacted angrily (I suppose)   
by hitting one of them.

Having suffered a not very pretty sight, I reacted by uttering  
some very cruel and sharp words.

On the TV news I heard that Nicaragua had complained about the 
increasing threat of war with the USA.

When I was caught sneaking back into the house at night after  
having  gone to a disco without permission.
When I met my girlfriend - I had not counted on that.
When I quarrelled with a very close friend of mine.

I received an unexpected letter from a friend I had met a short  
time before.  He sent me a poem and wished me good luck.  I felt  
very happy because I had great esteem for that person.

The day that the results of the college entrance examinations for  
the S. Paulo University were published and I didn't find my name  
on the list. Entering this University was my greatest wish, and   
the fact of not having succeded caused a great frustration, and  
not only sadness.

After a serie of facts that occurred between a colleague and me I  
started to feel a certain necessity to get apart and I didn't want  
to see her anymore.

I had an appointment with a colleague of mine to give her my  
lecture notes. I couldn't go and I didn't send them, and so the  
girl missed a day for the preparation of her term exams.
When my boy-friend left me and I wanted to persuade him to stay.
The stories about the way my grandmother treated my mother.

My friend had written a letter to me, the contents of which I  
misunderstood and I wrote back a very harsh letter to her.  On  
realizing the blunder I had made, I felt like hiding my face in  
the sand.

Once as a child I dreamed of a fire. Since that time I hadn't  
wanted to sleep in that bed and had feared the night darkness  
(and so it is now).

When I saw a film in which the man suffered from an illness and     
his skin came peeling off.

Losing close people and animals. So far, I've felt most when  
losing our dog in a traffic accident.
As in sadness (A), relating to this slaghter of fur-seals.

I happened to have met one of my teachers in town during working  
hours. The badness was I didn't ask for permission to go out and  
I was guilty-conscious.

I had to leave my girlfriend for 4 weeks because of my studies.  
This happens frequently. The last 24 hours before my departure  
are always very depressing.
My best friend suddenly acting strange towards me.

In autumn I had to move to another lodging. My landlords, quite  
intelligent people, warned me I had to move in the nearest  
future. But I had difficulties in moving my luggage because I  
couldn't wait for a car to come. How amazed I was to hear them  
threatening me they would throw our my things. And at that my  
luggage was well packed and did not stand in their way. I was  
quite  disappointed and disgusted.
A conflict with a pupil.
When I learnt that I had been accepted at the medical school.

My elder brother and I have not always had a good relationship  
and I feel ashamed of myself as I do not call him to talk to him  
nowadays.

I was disgusted to discover that my girlfriend of few weeks was  
already fooling around with another guy.  I was disappointed as  
the guy was a rogue and I respected my girlfriend.
When I was subjected to a very nasty joke by a group of friends.
I stopped working (had a boring job).
Despite our good performance and excellent results the management  refused to meet our demands.

When I did something wrong in the past and denied having done it
when asked about it later.

My friend promised to take me out for a movie but he didn't turn 
up.
Once I promised to do something but I didn't do it.
A too eager approach by a dirty drunken person in a bus.
A recurrent lovesickness.

When I first saw the state of a cafeteria in the grounds of the  
university. Due to students own lack of concern for the  
environment in which they eat and drink. Rubbish and spilled tea  
and coffee left everywhere.

One of my very good friends came to me for advice as her  
boyfriend had been hitting her and beating her quite harmfully.
When I had to leave home to go to some other place to study.

When I realized that I was pregnant.  I thought about what my  
relatives and friends would think about me and I felt a lot of  
self pity.

I experienced shame when I failed to keep a promise to meet my  
friend at the bus depot. He later came and asked me why I had not  
turned up.

When I drove partially across the country with my father. We  
stopped in a few towns and stayed overnight in motels. The joy I  
got was from the feedom I felt and the real beauty of the  
country.

After being away on a holiday for 2 months, a friend, who lived  
interstate, had remembered when I'd get back and phoned to  
welcome me home on the night of my arrival.

The behaviour of a colleague of mine, which doesn't correspond to  
my norms of behaviour.
When I got through the first day here at the department.

When I took the first year university exams and made a lot of  
mistakes in the P110 exam.  I was afraid of failing and thus  
being unable to go to the school of medicine.

Begining the week-end with my girlfriend : cozyness, beer and  
wine.

When I had to go to reconciliation before converting to  
Catholicism but then once received - o.k.

When my mother looked in my drawer (where I keep my personal  
things) and she found some porno photos that I have kept from  
more than a week, and split it.

My sister once stole my mother's money and made her very angry.   
After this my mother would beat her up for unreasonable reasons.   
One day my sister lent her book to a friend without telling my  
mother about it.  When my mother learnt this she beat her up and  
even threatened her with a pair of scissors.
I was selected to come here (University, College) when I was least expecting it.

A classmate told me I must have bribed the class leader to let me  
go to your English lecture.

Lately I've felt guilty because I'm folling behind in my classes  
and not studying much.
The birth of my daughter.
Soiled my short trousers with faeces.

When an acquaintance of mine told me about the way his parents  
treated their sons in an unequal manner.  The most successful of  
them got continuous encouragement, and the youngest was not  
encouraged and was rejected.

One night, walking along a park, I began to think that some  
roughnecks would appear suddenly with knives and things like  
that.
Being mistreated by my former primary school teacher, Mr Zalu.

I was asked to stop studying economics, a field which interested  
me, by my employers.

I am usually angry at myself. This happens often. For instace  
when I want to pet without falling in love and it soon proves  
that I have fallen in love with him.

When my close friend was involved in an accident and passed away  
instantly.  He had gone to buy a new car and had asked me to  
wait at his home so that I could see his new car.
When I got my B.Sc degree with first class.
My mother's death.

I was disgusted when I was told to dress a big rotten stinky  
wound which, coming closer, made me feel like vomitting.
Exchange of points of view with my sister on a family matter.
My best friend was not chosen for the English lectures.

As a child (i.e. 5-7) hiking in reasonably rugged bush and  
becoming lost for a duration of 5-7 hours.

When I failed my Primary school leaving Examinations. I never  
thought I would fail. When I heard I had failed I really felt  
ashamed of myself.

When I was 20 years old, I fell severely ill and was bed-ridden for  
6 months.  I felt very scared for my health and my studies.

The emotion came when a certain boy opened my locker without my 
knowledge.

For the above: guilt at not living up to my own moral  
expectation, guilt for not being the type of person my patents  
wanted, guilt for just about bloody everything, just realising  
that I have failed drastically in my own eyes.

The situation in which I felt happiest in my life was when  
I was with the person I love for the first time.
When I had to walk home in the dark for the first time.

A friend of mine had sex with someone of a different race on a  
Winnebago trip down to USC in front of everyone (all my friends  
embarrassed my sorority house name).
My first kiss.

When a friend carelessly broke and object in my parent's house  
and did not apologize, or pay, or anything.

When I saw a dead body in the mortuary I became afraid and I was  
filled with fear.

Someone stole my ski at Vitosha and of course I was the one to be  
blamed. I left them without supervision.

During the Christmas holidays, I met some of my old friends,  
after not having seen them for six months.
Bus conductor insulted me for not buying a ticket (I forgot).

When an argument with a friend of mine over our behaviour towards  
another friend turned into a quarrel.   I lost my temper and nearly  
knocked him out.

I was walking to my car at night and thought that I was being  
followed.

The last time I had to phone the Registry, after having called  
them so many times in the last few days.

On one occasion whilst engaging in horseplay with my girlfriend,  
I caused her to be physically harmed.

I had been very weary all week - no letters, no phonecalls, no  
visitors and then my younger sister came with some cheese, a card  
and some pocket money for me; and she told me that she was  
working now.

When a person is privileged in account of situations that are  
unjust, and disloyal to colleagues and friends.

When a friend of mine got drunk and started to blame and scorn my  
other friends and me.

Taking part in the mobbing of some girls in my class in primary  
school.

When I red a report in the magazine VESA about an Iranian telling  
what she had lived in the prisons in Iran. I felt disgust about  
that people.

When I realized that I was not working hard enough and was not  
being useful as an individual to the society or the family, guilt  
at spending money on uncalled for activities - in short wasting  
my life.
I was very sad at hearing that my grandfather had passed away.
At age 10 my foster grandmother died, I had a fear of dying.

This was the worst incident of my hostel life.  I was insulted by  
a close friend of mine on the eve of the New year and it totally  
spoiled my New year's night.
Confession to my parents about my involvement in a moped theft.
Saw on TV China winning the gold medals.
When I was not accepted as a student in finance and accounting.

I had told my boyfriend that I did not want to go on with our  
relationship.  I knew that I was important to him but I wanted to  
be free.  I saw that this was difficult for him but I remained  
firm and did not change my mind.
A girl I do not like kept coming to me and talking to me.
Some days ago I had a slight car accident through my fault.

A person I was attracted to walked me home in the rain and got  
sick.

When I was a child, I was always afraid of my father. Just when  
he looked at me, I felt frightened.
We had to finish the life of our 8 year-old dog.

During a ski tour with a friend, we two had drunk too much. When  
we went down the slope on ski, I lost my friend who had lost his  
way. I thought that something must have happened to him (he  
finally arrived but after a very long time).
The discovery that one has only thought of oneself.

I had a quarrel with my fiancT. When he admitted his fault,  
everything was allright. It was then for the first time that he  
surprised me with coffee and cake and a bunch of flowers.

Feeling inadequate in a group situation, being unable to convey  
my own thoughts and feelings.

My little cat which I had raised all by myself, hanged itself when  
playing in the garden.

Four weeks ago I felt very much touched to find an asciatic  
patient who had asked the very morning to be tapped of the fluid,  
dying in the evening. I was really disgusted because this was the  
Medical staff's negligence. Had the Clinical officers done  
something that very morning he might have been alive today.
I offended my mother.

I quarrelled with my younger sister because I had said something  
against her boyfriend.  Consequently she looked through me when  
she saw me as she thought that I was trying to separate them.   
She had misunderstood me.

I walked in on a teenage patient of mine (I work in a hospital)  
as he was going through my office drawers and he had removed  
money from my purse.

This situation happened when my friend me with a knife which I  
stole from him.

I went to a party with my boyfriend who got so drunk and started  
vomiting. It was so disgusting.

When I am dishonest to a friend to whom I am very close.  I  
feel guilty because I know that he gives a different version of  
the truth and I have not corrected these mistakes, and he is  
aware that I know that they are wrong.

Riding home from school after completing two midterms in two  
days, and feeling I did well on them.

When I was walking on the street, I slipped on the dung of a dog.  
I did not fall down, but I felt disgusted by the bad smell on my  
sole.

When my daughter gave her solo dance performance in Poona and  
there was a big applause, I was overjoyed.

I felt it when I came home after the examination session and I  
said I had not passed my last exam.

I had to wash my grandmother because she did not get to the  
bathroom on time.

My fiancee and I were at my parent's place watching TV. There  
were  only two TV-chairs and we were sitting on them when my  
drunken brother came in and rudely chased my fiancee off the  
chair she was sitting on.

When we rearranged furniture in our flat and got stuck in a  
chair.

A friend of mine uses butter instead of oil when he is cooking. I  
am always angry about that, because it is an unnecessary luxury.  
Recently we both were cooking and he wanted to use butter again.  
When I had already put the oil into the pan, he poured it out  
again and put the butter into the pan.
When a person whom I do not want to see is continously present.

I passed my MCE Examination. at first I was worried but when I  
heard my name I had joy in my heart and I arranged for a trip to  
attend a wedding ceremony.

When I heard about the treatment of a friend in jail. Really  
inhuman. I never realised that such things also happen in the  
Netherlands.

I got into a tight pair of trousers and examined myself in the  
mirror.  My back looked unpresentable and I felt ashamed at my  
wanting to wear those clothes that day.  I quickly changed into  
another dress.

I had promised to send something to a friend and it completely  
slipped my mind.  I felt guilty for having forgotten.
Unrealisation of the desired profession (aviator).
Insulted by classmate in public.

My parents do not like my friend and told me not to go out with  
him.
The girl I was seeing didn't want to have a serious relationship.
I made a comment that at the moment didn't fit.

My fear appeared in the form of jealousy. I was afraid that my  
girl-friend had fallen in love with another man, I was afraid to  
lose her.

My superior at the summer job swindled customers as much as he  
could, and once put me in a difficult situation after which I  
could not but detest him.

When I was on holiday with my former boyfriend, he hit me and  
behaved in a very evil and ugly manner in front of the hotel  
personnel.

A friend of mine has not very much money. Therefore, once I  
stayed with him and his girlfriend, I bought some meat, but nobody  
wanted to go and prepare it for dinner. My friend said "I thought  
you wanted to invite us for dinner". "Of course", I said, but I  
thought by myself that it must have been enough that I had bought  
it.

When people would tell me that my ex-girlfriend was playing  
around on me.

When the brother-in-law of a girlfriend of mine found us in a  
bedroom with clothes and panties spread all over the place.

I did badly in one of the vital exams, despite getting proper  
guidance from my parents.  I felt guilty of improper use of the  
chances provided to me.

When my mother and father were on an excursion in Chechoslovakia  
and I was at a student camp and I heard over the radio about the  
events that were taking place there.

One day my room-mate started imitating me, doing what I had done  
a few hours back.  I got very angry and started beating him up.

I was going around with a foreigner's wife and my entire family  
got to know about it, this was just when I had become a  
Christian.
When my elder brother died.

I had promised myself that I would do one good deed every day.   
One night I saw a beggar whose muscles had been atrophyed.  I  
walked passed him thinking that he was feigning.  Later I  
realized that he had not been pretending and I had a feeling of  
guilt as I had not kept my promise.
Had a nice letter from my close friend.

Once I had to clean a lavatory which was obstructed.  It was in a  
friend's country house and there was nobody there to help me.

To have a friend who I didn't see for months, and under the  
circumstances that I met him made me feel happy, and perhaps  
because it has been one of the good things that I learned with  
this friend.

My first girlfriend. I had the feeling that she was going out  
with me only because of my defect.
When someone tried to bewitch me and my friends at night.

An incident occurred to me when I was going home with my  
girlfriend. On the way, a man named Banda grabbed my girlfriend  
in my presence. I was really angry with him and as a result I  
threw stones at him and he ran away.
Sleeping through crew practice one Monday morning.

Once our school class went skiing. On a steep slope a boy  
standing behind me lost his balance, fell down and drew me with  
him. I slided down the whole slope. At about 1 m distance from a  
tree I could stop.
When I learnt that I had been admitted to the university.

When I reproached my friend because I was myself low-spirited and  
disappointed.

I had this feeling when I met a girl, not that she was dirty but  
she was to "fresh", dump and childish.

When I saw my father coming out of the bathroom. He thought that  
he was alone at home and came out without his clothes.
The birth of my first child.

A friend's boy-friend treated her very badly, let her serve him,  
provoked her and just utilized her.

I had gone to aa bookshop to buy some books.  Somehow, I got very  
cross with the security guard checking through what I had bought.  
 I lost my temper and screamed at him.  Later I felt very ashamed  
at myself as a lot of people I know were there.

When I did bad on a chamistry midterm which I could have done  
well.

My best friend had failed Exams. She had to leave and so we got  
separated.

Last year I passed the B.A exams in Psychology in which I stood first  
in my class.  Thus I got the first prize from the college.  I was  
most happy to tell all this to my parents and friends.
When I was walking around all alone at night.

An uncle of mine who just retired, having worked hard all his  
life, got a cerebral hemorrhage.

The mother of a friend of mine passed by me and saw me sitting  
on a boy's lap.  I tried to greet her but could not help  
blushing.

After a footballmatch I went home by car, a friend drove. I did  
not realize that he was drunk until we were in the car. He was  
madly racing. Several times we were in dangerous situations and I  
told him to be cautious, but he did not care.

When I had to prepare and read a paper to my fellow students but  
I didn't cope with the task.
When I passed and qualified for the university.

I had obviously done the work badly but my class-mates of the  
student's association did not blame me, they helped me do the  
work.

When I had not been accepted to a college which I dreamed of  
going to. I felt that I had let myself and my parents down.

On a trip to Santander we wanted to stop at a curve because a  
friend was sick, and the car skidded of the gravel.
Did not do what I promised to do for a friend.
When I refused to fetch water for my aunty while she was busy.

My sister said I am not a stable person, and I think she is  
right.
Success in university entrance examination.

When my girlfriend told me that she was no longer interested in  
me.
When I met an elephant in the bush.

I had arranged with a friend to go with him to Carinthia by car.  
We had arranged a place where to meet. I was a bit late and my  
friend had left already. I had no money to go by train. I nearly  
started to cry because I was so angry - it was very important for  
me to go to Carinthia.

When my room-mates were watching video-tapes and prevented me  
from watching the news.  The first feeling I had was that I was  
being treated unfairly and then came the feeling of anger.

I was very sad  when I got the XIIth standard results, when I got  
low marks as compared to my friend and I could not get admission  
to courses like medicine.

On the way home one Friday night in the heavy rain the car  
acquaplanned.  I lost contact with the road surface for a few  
seconds.

I had gone camping with my old classmates and there was a storm.   
We were in a flurry but at that time I felt the love and concern  
of my friends.

I had a dream about my fiancTe leaving me and making an end to  
our relation.
My friend was badly hurt.
I saw a program on T.V where they had to saw a skull for an         operation.

I feel shame every time I think of very dear friends of mine  
abroad who were family to me for a year, and now 2 years later, I  
have attempted, but have not actually gone through with  
corresponding with them, to express my feelings and gratitude.

When I fell in love with "X".  Overnight I felt confidence, self-esteem,     
responsible and worthwhile.

When I made the winning goal during a very important football  
game.

When you told everyone in the last lecture you will do all  
lectures again in English and everybody can come (not only  
English classes)

When as a child I stole, from a friend of mine, the ring she had  
got in an easter egg.

After hearing about the death of my grandfather.  First I could  
not believe it, but later I wept and felt the situation was  
hopeless.  I felt lonely and wanted to be consolated.

I was on my surf ski. Rather large waves to strong current  
separated me from my ski and we both began to drift slowly  
(actually rather quickly) away to sea. The direction I was  
drifting in was taking me straight over a reef on which rather  
large sharks were constantly being caught. (I was alone with no  
one to help me).

When I discovered my mother had been having an affair with my  
father's best friend, and then ran away with him without even  
speaking to me about what she was doing letting me come home from  
school simply to find her gone. I was filled with disgust and  
contempt.
When they tried to rob me.

On New Year's Eve I went in a disco with friends. I amused myself  
and got to know many other people.

I was in the Korean War. We were attacked with mortars, me and  
companion. We stopped the jeep and ran for cover. Fortunately  
neither of us was hit but we both came close to being killed.
When my child was born.

When I failed to secure employment after my form 5 in Lusaka despite  
my excellent certificate.

When I didn't notify someone that he was summoned by a headmaster  
and as a result he ended being on a heavy punishment.

I felt disgust with alcohol in general when a close friend of  
mine got so drunk that he didn't realize what he was doing and it  
was quite shameful.

When I was making music together with my friend. It sounded very  
good and we were very satisfied.

Once I arrived two hours late to my work place (a bank) and I was  
still feeling feeble and tired.

When I told my boy-friend, who loved me very much, that I wanted  
to put an end to our relationship. a long time before I told him  
that and also a long time after that I felt guilty, because I had  
hurt him so much.

My father had been alone for a long time because my mother and  
sister were on holiday. I had not seen him for a long time and  
when I finally called him I realized that he had been very sad  
about that.
While playing a ball game, I made a mistake and we lost the game.

I was walking through a thick forest and there was a big snake at  
a distance of about four metres.
When my dog died.

I felt guilty when I mislead a person into thinking he was a  
close friend when that person was more of a casual acquaintance.

The breaking up of a relationship.  We decided that the
